docs.lead_paragraph: Switzerland's UBS, the world's largest wealth management company in terms of assets, has issued a worldwide travel ban for wealth management client advisors, a spokeswoman told Reuters.
docs.abstract: Switzerland's UBS, the world's largest wealth management company in terms of assets, has issued a worldwide travel ban for wealth management client advisors, a spokeswoman told Reuters. "Last week, we issued a general travel ban for all staff with client contact in international wealth management," the spokeswoman for the bank said. "UBS is currently conducting [...]

headline.main: UBS Instates Travel Ban for Wealth Management

docs.snippet: Al Jamahiriya, a government newspaper, has published a rare criticism of the authorities, denouncing officials who bar Libyan women from traveling abroad alone. “Turning back women traveling alone is a stark and crude abuse of basic women’s ri...
docs.lead_paragraph: Al Jamahiriya, a government newspaper, has published a rare criticism of the authorities, denouncing officials who bar Libyan women from traveling abroad alone. “Turning back women traveling alone is a stark and crude abuse of basic women’s rights,” the newspaper said. It urged Libyans to “file suits against those who interfere in our lives.” Airports and border posts are controlled by the Interior Ministry. Some conservative Islamic scholars in Libya argue that traveling Muslim women must be accompanied by a male relative.

headline.main: Libya: Paper Assails Ban on Women’s Travel
headline.print_headline: Libya: Paper Assails Ban on Women’s Travel

docs.snippet: Belarus criticized moves by the European Union and the United States to restrict the movements of its senior officials in protest over the disappearance of three opposition politicians and a journalist in 1999 and 2000 and threatened to respond in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Belarus criticized moves by the European Union and the United States to restrict the movements of its senior officials in protest over the disappearance of three opposition politicians and a journalist in 1999 and 2000 and threatened to respond in kind. President Aleksandr Lukashenko said Brussels and Washington were intensifying pressure on his country ahead of an Oct. 17 referendum on whether he can serve a third term.
docs.abstract: Belarus President Aleksandr Lukashenko holds that United States and European Union travel ban for government officials is designed to influence voters before Oct 17 referendum deciding whether or not Lukashenko can serve third term (S)

headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Belarus: Travel Ban Criticized
U.S. MAINTAINS BAN ON MIDEAST TRAVEL

docs.snippet: A Pakistani court on Thursday ordered the government to lift a travel ban on former military ruler Pervez Musharraf, his lawyer said, paving the way for him to leave the country in 15 days' time....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Pakistani court on Thursday ordered the government to lift a travel ban on former military ruler Pervez Musharraf, his lawyer said, paving the way for him to leave the country in 15 days' time.

headline.main: Pakistani Court Lifts Musharraf Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Court Lifts Musharraf Travel Ban
